page.title: 03Lighthouse & Ruined Village.
page.content: {Start Point Lighthouse}(SX829372) On the top of Start Point is the Lighthouse -manned by three keepers- whose beam can be seen 14 miles to sea.It has been shown to act as the last positive landmark for migratory birds on their journey south. {Hallsands Ruined Village}(SX818385) South Hallsands was until the 1920's a prosperous fishing village of over 30 houses,at the base of the cliffline on the shingle beach. Fishing was mainly for crabs & lobsters.Excavation of shingle in the late 19th. century by Sir John Jackson,to build new dock facilities at Devonport led to loss of shingle;the shingle beach acted as a natural breakwater for the village. Consequently the village became exposed to storm wave action from c.1900 onwards.this culminated in the winterstorm of 26th.January,1917......
